verses.roman:
yoga-dhāraṇayā kāṁścid
āsanair dhāraṇānvitaiḥ
tapo-mantrauṣadhaiḥ kāṁścid
upasargān vinirdahet

synonyms: yoga-dhāraṇayā—by yogic meditation; kāṁścit—some disturbances; āsanaiḥ—by prescribed postures; dhāraṇā-anvitaiḥ—together with meditation on controlled breathing; tapaḥ—by special austerities; mantra—magical chants; auṣadhaiḥ—and medicinal herbs; kāṁścit—some; upasargān—obstructions; vinirdahet—can be eradicated.
translation: Some of these obstructions may be counteracted by yogic meditation or by sitting postures, practiced together with concentration on controlled breathing, and others may be counteracted by special austerities, mantras or medicinal herbs.
